A [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/TimeInterval] value is always specified in seconds; it yields sub-millisecond precision over a range of 10,000 years.

# TimeInterval

**Type Alias**

A number of seconds.

## Declaration

```swift
typealias TimeInterval = Double
```

## Discussion

A [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/TimeInterval] value is always specified in seconds; it yields sub-millisecond precision over a range of 10,000 years.

On its own, a time interval does not specify a unique point in time, or even a span between specific times. Combining a time interval with one or more known reference points yields a [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date] or [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/DateInterval] value.

## Date Representations

- **Date**: A specific point in time, independent of any calendar or time zone.
- **DateInterval**: The span of time between a specific start date and end date.
